description:
https://github.com/rackspace/python-novaclient hasn't been updated in four months. Could it be updated to direct people to https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient ?

ADDITIONAL DETAILS

github.com/rackspace/python-novaclient is referenced in the documentation.
title: github.com/rackspace/python-novaclient is stale

comments.content:
https://github.com/rackspace/python-novaclient hasn't been updated in four months. Could it be updated to direct people to https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient ?

ADDITIONAL DETAILS

github.com/rackspace/python-novaclient is referenced in the documentation.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~lloydde

comments.content: Where in the doc ? In Nova itself ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: We don't really control https://github.com/rackspace/python-novaclient but I guess we can try to talk to people. Adding a -ci task for that.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
@ttx> Where in the doc ? In Nova itself ?

In the Diablo version of the Compute Administration Guide: Migrating from Cactus to Diablo, and currently in the trunk version of the document as well, though I'll file a separate document bug for that.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~lloydde

comments.content: Lloyd: you can also reuse this bug by clicking "Also affects project" and type "openstack-manuals".
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
ttx: Thanks! I noticed when you used that above. I tend to be pretty symptom oriented, and I'm sure that whole section will be rewritten for Essex. The bug I'm filing vs docs is that the two sections related to installing novaclient need to be consistent with each other, and I'll note the bad link as wel..

Here the symptom is that a historically popular link provides stale packages and stale information.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~lloydde
